hanzi-su-wiki:
永

Значения

Долгий, вечный

Мнемоника

Вода 水 с ограничительной чертой наверху как постоянство циркуляции влаги.
purpleculture_pinyin:
yǒng
forever; always; perpetual
навсегда; всегда; вечный
rtega_mnemonic:
永永RS
X		long time, eternal
  • generations have been drinking water 水 from the village well 丶丶
 悠 久 長; 泳 詠

永永RS𣱵long, perpetual, eternal, forever
  • man 丶 crossing a large body of water 水: it seems like ages before he reaches the other side; water 水 with cover 亠: old aquifer with water that has been there forever 𣱵
悠 久 長; 泳 詠
purpleculture_examples:
永远 [ yǒng yuǎn ]: forever; eternal
永久 [ yǒng jiǔ ]: everlasting; perpetual; lasting; forever; permanent
永恒 [ yǒng héng ]: eternal; everlasting; fig. to pass into eternity (i.e. to die)
永不 [ yǒng bù ]: never; will never
永生 [ yǒng shēng ]: to live forever; eternal life; all one's life
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 水 [ shuǐ ] water, liquid, lotion, juice
heisig_chinese_memo: It would take an eternity to count all the drops of water.
heisig_story: This kanji also uses the full form of water, though its meaning seems to have nothing at all to do with water. Remember what William Blake said about seeing "infinity in a grain of sand and eternity in an hour"? Well, reading this character from top to bottom, we see "eternity in a drop of water."
koohiiStory1: It would take an eternity to count all the drops of water.
koohiiStory2: It takes but one drop from the most special water: the fountain of youth (and it is written in a special way to with an extra horizontal line on the top) to live for an eternity. (In order to remember that the drop is at the top, think that the drop must come from the topmost water in order for its effects to be true).
jp_example_words:
永遠(えいえん): eternity, perpetuity, immortality, permanence
永久(えいきゅう): eternity, perpetuity, immortality
永い(ながい): long, lengthy
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The eternity radical and the eternity kanji are the same!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: How long is an eternity? Just look at this little acorn (えい) and ask. The acorn starts small but it grows into a huge tree and can live for all eternity by dropping more acorns to create more trees. Its acorn line will live on forever!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: It's the miracle of eternal life!
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 泳 (およぐ、エイ плавать), 水 (みず、スイ вода), 氷 (こおり、ヒョウ лёд).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: ice (冫) and water (水) last a long time
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: It would take an eternity to count all the drops of water.
origin_of_ch_char_book: The Yellow River that flows through China is one of the longest rivers in the world. The river is so long that the ancient Chinese probably thought that it was endless. Therefore, a long river’s endless flow came to mean “forever”. (永, yong, forever) was created to mean such thoughts. The character shows a person (人, ren, human), a road (行, xing=hsing, line), and a flow of water . It signifies a man swimming in the river: (泳, yong, swim) or walking next to a river. He would think the river is so long, and the flow of water is endless.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: Jiajin Wenxiang River is very long and has tributaries. The original meaning is that rivers have a long history. The extension is long and permanent. The ancient word " Yong " is either left or right, left and right, and it means two words at the same time, one is the long-term " Yong ", and the other is the tributary " 𠂢 " ("派"). Later, in order to make the meaning of the word clear, it was stipulated that the character with the left side of the font was "永", and the one with the right side was " 𠂢 " (Qiu Xigui).

It is said that " Yong " elephant people swimming in the water (see Gao Hongjin, Takada Zhongzhou, Xu Zhongshu, Liu Xinglong) is the first text of " swimming ", which means swimming.

Oracle is used as names of people and places.

Jinwen means permanent and long-term. Free Gui: "Treasure forever." Chen Hou Wu Dun: "Eternal Mother (Don't) Forget." Song Ding: "Tong Yi (Lu), Yong Ling (Ming)" means full blessing (that is, full blessing) and long life. Chen Boyuan: "Eternal life" means longevity.

The stone inscription means forever, "Stone Drum Wen. "My Water": "The emperor always mao", which means the emperor is always peaceful.

The usage of the word "永" today is mainly the abstract meaning of "forever." This kind of usage can actually be traced back to ancient texts and ancient documents, such as the above-mentioned inscriptions such as "children Sun Yongbao", "Shangshu" in "Yongkang Zhaomin", "Shou Tian Yongming", "The Book of Songs" "Always think it's good", "Let's keep it forever", etc. As for the explanation, it can be traced back to "Shuowen": "Yong, long. Like the length of the waters. The "Poetry" says: "The river is forever." Every eternal belonging is from eternity."

Later it has been in a " sheep " Notes " permanent " derived " Yang " word, to show the "permanent" goodness, see " Yang ."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: Jiajin Wenxiang River is very long and has tributaries. The original meaning is that rivers have a long history. The extension is long and permanent.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文象河流很長，並有支流。本義是江河源遠流長。引申為長久、永久。古文字「永」或向左，或向右，左右無別，同時表示兩個詞，一是長久的「永」，二是支流、支派的「𠂢」(「派」)。後來為了使字義明確，才規定以字形向左的為「永」字，向右的為「𠂢」字(裘錫圭)。

　　一說「永」象人在水中游泳 (參高鴻縉、高田忠周、徐中舒、劉興隆)，是「泳」的初文，本義為游泳。

　　甲骨文用作人名、地名。

　　金文表示永久、長遠。免簋：「萬年永寶用」。陳侯午敦：「永世母(毋)忘」。頌鼎：「通彔(祿)、永令(命)」，表示全福(即滿福)、長命。陳伯元匜：「永壽」，表示長壽。

　　石刻文字表示永遠，《石鼓文．吾水》：「天子永寍」，意謂天子永遠安寧。

　　「永」字今日的用法，主要是抽象意義的「永久」。這一種用法，其實可遠溯至古文字和上古文獻，如上述銘文一類的套語「子子孫孫永寶用」，《尚書》中的「永康兆民」、「受天永命」，《詩經》中的「永以為好」、「終其永懷」等。至於訓解則可追溯到《說文》：「永，長也。象水巠理之長。《詩》曰：『江之永矣』。凡永之屬皆从永。」

　　後來又曾有人以「羊」注「永」而得「羕」字，以顯示「永久」的美善，參見「羕」。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象河流很長，並有支流。本義是江河源遠流長。引申為長久、永久。

甲金文象河流很長，並有支流。本義是江河源遠流長。引申為長久、永久。古文字「 永 」或向左，或向右，左右無別，同時表示兩個詞，一是長久的「 永 」，二是支流、支派的「 𠂢 」(「 派 」)。後來為了使字義明確，才規定以字形向左的為「 永 」字，向右的為「 𠂢 」字(裘錫圭)。 一說「 永 」象人在水中游泳 (參高鴻縉、高田忠周、徐中舒、劉興隆)，是「 泳 」的初文，本義為游泳。 甲骨文用作人名、地名。 金文表示永久、長遠。免簋：「萬年永寶用」。陳侯午敦：「永世母(毋)忘」。頌鼎：「通彔(祿)、永令(命)」，表示全福(即滿福)、長命。陳伯元匜：「永壽」，表示長壽。 石刻文字表示永遠，《石鼓文．吾水》：「天子永寍」，意謂天子永遠安寧。 「 永 」字今日的用法，主要是抽象意義的「永久」。這一種用法，其實可遠溯至古文字和上古文獻，如上述銘文一類的套語「子子孫孫永寶用」，《尚書》中的「永康兆民」、「受天永命」，《詩經》中的「永以為好」、「終其永懷」等。至於訓解則可追溯到《說文》：「永，長也。象水巠理之長。《詩》曰：『江之永矣』。凡永之屬皆从永。」 後來又曾有人以「 羊 」注「 永 」而得「 羕 」字，以顯示「永久」的美善，參見「 羕 」。
Elaboration: Jiajin Wenxiang River is very long and has tributaries. The original meaning is that rivers have a long history. The extension is long and permanent. The ancient word " Yong" is either left or right, left and right, and it means two words at the same time, one is the long-term " Yong", and the other is the tributary " 𠂢" (" 派"). Later, in order to make the meaning of the word clear, it was stipulated that the character with the left side of the font was " 永", and the one with the right side was " 𠂢" (Qiu Xigui). It is said that " Yong" elephant people swimming in the water (see Gao Hongjin, Takada Zhongzhou, Xu Zhongshu, Liu Xinglong) is the first text of " swimming", which means swimming. Oracle is used as names of people and places. Jinwen means permanent and long-term. Free Gui: "Treasure forever." Chen Hou Wu Dun: "Eternal Mother (Don't) Forget." Song Ding: "Tong Yi (Lu), Yong Ling (Ming)" means full blessing (that is, full blessing) and long life. Chen Boyuan: "Eternal life" means longevity. The stone inscription means forever, "Stone Drum Wen. "My Water": "The emperor always mao", which means the emperor is always peaceful. The usage of the word " 永" today is mainly the abstract meaning of "forever." This kind of usage can actually be traced back to ancient texts and ancient documents, such as the above-mentioned inscriptions such as "children Sun Yongbao", "Shangshu" in "Yongkang Zhaomin", "Shou Tian Yongming", "The Book of Songs" "Always think it's good", "Let's keep it forever", etc. As for the explanation, it can be traced back to "Shuowen": "Yong, long. Like the length of the waters. The "Poetry" says: "The river is forever." Every eternal belonging is from eternity." 永字的基本解释

永
yǒng
水流长：“江之永矣”。
久远：永远。永生。隽永。永昼（长昼）。永年（ａ．整年；ｂ．长寿）。永诀。永志不忘。永垂不朽。
古同“咏”，以诗词等来叙述。

永字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǒng］
［《廣韻》于憬切，上梗，云。］
(1)指水流长。
(2)泛指长。兼指时间和空间。
(3)延长。
(4)犹度过、消磨。
(5)永久，永远。
(6)终；一直。
(7)通“咏”、“詠”。《书·舜典》：“詩言志，歌永言。”《汉书·礼乐志》引作“歌咏言”，《汉书·艺文志》引作“歌詠言”。一说“永”仍为“长”义。《史记·五帝本纪》引作“詩言志，歌長言”。
(8)通“泳”。
(9)水名。源出湖南省零陵县西南，东北流入湘江。参阅清顾祖禹《读史方舆纪要·湖广七·永州府》。
(10)古州名。隋改零陵郡为永州，元改为永州路，明、清为永州府。郡治在今湖南省零陵县。参阅清顾祖禹《读史方舆纪要·湖广七·永州府》。
(11)古州名。辽置。故址在今内蒙古自治区西拉木伦河与老哈河会合处。契丹部族的发祥地。参阅清李兆洛《历代地理志韵编今释》。
(12)姓。

永字的英文翻译

◎ 永
always, forever

永字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　永； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页603第04
【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】?于憬切，音栐。【說文】水長也。象水巠理之長。【詩·周南】江之永矣。　又【爾雅·釋詁】遠也，遐也。【揚子·方言】凡施于衆長謂之永。【書·大禹謨】萬世永賴。【詩·周頌】永觀厥成。　又州名。【韻會】唐置以二水名。　又姓。【列仙傳】有永石公。　又【集韻】【正韻】?與詠同。【書·舜典】詩言志，歌永言。【傳】謂歌詠其義，以長其言也。音詠。又如字。

永字的源字形

永字的起名意思

永字本义是指水常流不断，《诗经•周南•汉广》云：“江之永矣，不可方思。”《疏》曰：“永，长。”。后来也引申为长久、永久、长远。永字是人名常用字，因为它不仅能表现个人的健康长寿、家运永远，又能表现国家的昌盛、社会的安定。

Forever
Basic explanation of words
Forever
yǒng
Long water flow: "The river is forever."
Jiuyuan: Forever. eternal life. Timeless. Eternal day (long day). Yongnian (a. Whole year; b. Longevity). part forever. Never forget. Immortal.
The ancient same "chong" is narrated by poetry and so on.
Forever
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yǒng］
["Guang Yun" Yu Jing cut, top stem, cloud. ]
(1) Refers to water flow length.
(2) Generally refers to long. Refers to both time and space.
(3) Extension.
(4) It's still spent and spent.
(5) Forever, forever.
(6) Finally; always.
(7) Through "Ying" and "Ying". "Shu Shun Dian": "Poetry expresses ideals, song always speaks." "Hanshu·Liyuezhi" quoted as "singing words", "Hanshu·Yiwenzhi" quoted as "singing words". One said that "forever" still means "long". "Historical Records: The Benji of Five Emperors" is quoted as "Poetry expresses ideals, song expresses long words"
(8) Through "swimming".
(9) Water name. It originates from the southwest of Lingling County, Hunan Province, and flows into the Xiangjiang River from the northeast. Refer to Qing Gu Zuyu's "Minutes of Reading History and Fangyu·Huguang Seven·Yongzhou Mansion".
(10) The name of the ancient state. In the Sui Dynasty, Lingling County was changed to Yongzhou, Yuan was changed to Yongzhou Road, and Ming and Qing were named Yongzhou Prefecture. The county seat is now Lingling County, Hunan Province. Refer to Qing Gu Zuyu's "Minutes of Reading History and Fangyu·Huguang Seven·Yongzhou Mansion".
(11) The name of the ancient state. Liaozhi. The former site was at the confluence of the Xila Mulun River and the Laoha River in the present-day Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The birthplace of the Khitan tribe. Please refer to Li Zhaoluo's "Compilation and Modern Explanation of Geography Records in Past Dynasties".
(12) Last name.
Forever
English translation of words
◎ Yong
always, forever
Forever
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Siji 1] [Water Word Department] 　永; Kangxi Strokes: 5; Page Number: Page 603 04
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Positive Rhyme]? Yu Jingqie, sound bar. [Said the text] Water is also long. It is like the length of the water 巠理. 【Poetry·Zhou Nan】Jiang Zhi forever.　[Erya·Shi Xuan] Far away, ya Ye. [Yangtze Dialect] Whatever is done to the people is eternal. 【Book·Da Yumo】Living forever. 【Poetry·Zhou Song】Eternal View Juecheng.　Also the name of the state. [Rhyme Club] Tang Zhi was named Ershui.　Another last name. [Legend of Immortals] There is Lord Yongshi.　[Ji Yun] [Zheng Yun]? Same with Yong. [Book·Shun Dian] Poetry expresses ideals, song always speaks. [Biography] It is said that singing is chanting its meaning, and its words are also long. Yin Yong. Another example.
Forever
Source glyph
Forever
Name meaning
The original meaning of the word "Yong" refers to the constant flow of water. "The Book of Songs·Zhou Nan·Han Guang" says: "The river is forever, and it is impossible to think about it." "Shu" said: "Yong, long.". Later it was also extended to be long-term, permanent, and long-term. Yongzi is a commonly used word for names, because it can not only express the health and longevity of the individual, and the eternal fortune of the family, but also the prosperity of the country and the stability of the society.
永
yŏng
(附) 派 咏
永
一条大河,派生出一条小河。
“永”、“泉"(“派”的本字)原为同
一个字,“派”是“支流”的意思。这
条有支流的河很长,所以有“水流
长”义。“永”又通“詠”(咪),《尚
书》:“诗言志,歌永言”。
永多永
Навсегда
молодой
(Прилагается) Пай Ён
Навсегда
Из большой реки вытекает маленькая.
«永» и «泉» (исходное слово «派») изначально были одним и тем же словом, а «派» означает «приток».
Эта река с притоками очень длинная, поэтому имеет значение «длинный водоток».
«Юн» также означает «Инь» (Ми), «Шан Шу»: «Поэзия говорит за волю, песня говорит вечно».
Ён Да Ён
yǒng
вечный, бесконечный; долгий, продолжительный; постоянный; вечно, навечно; всегда; навсегда; долго, надолго; никогда (перед отрицанием)
永久 долговременный
永恒 вечный
永不自满 никогда не зазнаваться

Юн (фамилия)
Radicals: 永  (eternity)
Meaning Mnemonic
The eternity radical and the eternity kanji are the same!
Know your radicals, yo!
Reading Mnemonic
How long is an eternity? Just look at this little acorn (えい) and ask. The acorn starts small but it grows into a huge tree and can live for all eternity by dropping more acorns to create more trees. Its acorn line will live on forever!
It's the miracle of eternal life!
